that the reason doc spin is not illegal is because of section 230 of the communications decency Act and the CDA
is a US federal law which provides immunity to platforms which host or republish users content
and so what this essentially means is that doc Spin and other websites which publish users content cannot be held
legally liable for what their users say and do and a good case example of this is gamergate and this was a case in 2014
by a female game developer called Brianna woo and she sued Twitter because Twitter users were uploading her docs to
the platform and sharing her docs and making death threats but Twitter actually won the case because under the
CDA they could not be held legally liable for what they users say and do and so docman takes the stance that even
though uh doxes can be uploaded which are used to intimidate and extort people they are not responsible or reliable for
the information that is uploaded to the platform under the CDA now there are other laws which
broadly apply to doxing and one of them is the US Interstate communication statute and this effectively
criminalizes any communication which contains a threat to injure a person and the important part is the threatened
party does not need to actually receive that threat directly and so for example if a victim's do docs is published on
Doc bin and it includes a written threat this is this this will violate the US
Interstate communication statute even if the victim doesn't receive that dock spin link
directly there's also a third piece of legislation which applies which is uh the US Interstate stalking statute and
this effectively prohibits any use of a computer which places a person in fear of death serious bodily injury or causes
